items.title: Add ini parser for variables argument
items.body:
Our Use-Case is to have a platform yaml file and overwrite it with a second user yaml file. 

Would it be possible to add **parser.addini()** for variables? 

Duplicates won't work in pytest ini files which is fine for us.

items.title: PytestUnknownMarkWarning for marks that have pytest.ini entries
items.body:
I am getting a `PytestUnknownMarkWarning` for each of my `@pytest.mark.some_mark` decorated test functions whenever I run pytest with `--variables <variables_file>`. All of the marks have entries in my `pytest.ini` and I do not receive those warnings unless I use `--variables  <variables_file>`.

It almost seems like the `markers` entries in pytest.ini are ignored while using `pytest-variables` plugin. Might there be something I'm forgetting to do?

items.title: PyYAML 5.1 deprecation of the plain yaml.load(input)
items.body: As of PyYAML version 5.1 plain `yaml.load()` call issues a depresiation warning. As per explanation in: https://msg.pyyaml.org/load one could use `yaml.safe_load` for instance.

items.title: File location and comments
items.body:
Just as constructive feedback, I'll mention the two reasons why this plugin didn't work for me:

- I added `addopts = --variables variables.json` to my pytest.ini, but this always looks for variables.json in the current folder. I wanted to be able to specify what relative folder from rootdir to use to look for variables.json, as I don't always run my tests from the same folder. 

- No comments allowed in the json file. I know, I know, I was hoping the json would be minimized before parsing.

Otherwise, good idea.

items.title: Use more platforms and browsers on the same command line
items.body:
Hello,

Currently every `json` file I have in my project, is specified some platform and browser (exactly as shown in the documentation of this project). So now this command is working perfectly for me and generating a report in the allure:

`pytest smoke --driver BrowserStack --variables capabilities/chrome-61.json --variables capabilities/windows.json --alluredir=allure-results -v -s`

My problem is that I need to test on more platforms and browsers and generate all these results in a single allure report. So in this case I'm trying to do the below code, but is not working:

`pytest smoke --driver BrowserStack --variables capabilities/chrome-61.json --variables capabilities/windows.json --variables capabilities/chrome-61.json --variables capabilities/osx.json --alluredir=allure-results -v -s`

Is there any easy way to make this work? That is, test across multiple platforms and browsers on a single command line?

Cheers,
Rafael

items.title: Merge dict variables
items.body:
This is a new proposed feature for ``pytest-variables``: merge dict variables instead of replace a key value based on command line order.

For example for a given command line option ``--variables capabilities/WIN10-FIREFOX53.json --variables capabilities capabilities/debug.json``

where the content of the ``capabilities/WIN10-FIREFOX53.json`` file is:
```
{                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
    "MYPROJECT": {                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
        "capabilities": {                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
            "browser": "Firefox",                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
            "browser_version": "53.0",                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
            "os": "Windows",                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
            "os_version": "10",                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
            "resolution": "1280x1024"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
        }                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
    }                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
}
```

and the content of the ``capabilities/debug.json`` file is:
```                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
{                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
    "MYPROJECT": {                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
        "capabilities": {                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
            "browserstack.debug": true                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
        }                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
    }
}
```

the result should be a merged dict like that:
```
{                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
    "MYPROJECT": {                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
        "capabilities": {                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
            "browser": "Firefox",                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
            "browser_version": "53.0",                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
            "os": "Windows",                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
            "os_version": "10",                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
            "resolution": "1280x1024",
            "browserstack.debug": true                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
        }                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
    }                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
}
```

Does it make sense? If yes I'm available for voluntary work :)

items.title: TypeError: the JSON object must be str, not 'bytes'

```

Environment:
* CentOS 6
* Python 3.4
* pytest 3.0.7
* pytest-variables 1.6.0

items.title: Remove print statement for unsupported format for files with no extension
items.body:
When a file is passed without a file extension we print a message stating that we didn't find a suitable parser, and then assume the format is JSON. This happens in [Jenkins](http://jenkins-ci.org/) using the [Config File Provider plugin](https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Config+File+Provider+Plugin), which by default creates a temporary file without an extension. As no file extension is provided, we'd never find a suitable parser, so it's safe to simply assume it's JSON and avoid this message.

The relevant code is [here](https://github.com/davehunt/pytest-variables/blob/e2c1c97f394d0440ed87df85e0dcbec4f36c4318/pytest_variables.py#L51-L53) and this change should be accompanied with at least one test.
